title: How to Connect an iPhone to a Car: Bluetooth, Cables, and More

steps.title: Check if your car stereo has Bluetooth.
steps.content: Check if your car stereo has Bluetooth. Read the owner’s manual to see if your head unit supports Bluetooth connectivity. You can also look for the Bluetooth logo on the stereo itself, indicating that the feature is supported.

steps.title: Start Bluetooth Pairing Mode on your car stereo.
steps.content: Start Bluetooth Pairing Mode on your car stereo. Press the menu button on the car stereo to find the Bluetooth pairing menu. Check your car stereo’s manual if you do not know how to enable your car stereo’s Bluetooth.

steps.title: Enable Bluetooth on your iPhone.
steps.content: Enable Bluetooth on your iPhone. This is usually turned off to save battery. There are a couple of ways to turn Bluetooth on: Open the Settings app, tap "Bluetooth," then toggle Bluetooth on. Swipe down from the top of the screen and tap the Bluetooth button to turn it on.

steps.title: Select your car stereo in the list of Bluetooth devices on your iPhone.
steps.content: Select your car stereo in the list of Bluetooth devices on your iPhone. As long as your car stereo is in pairing mode, you should see it listed in the available Bluetooth devices. It may be labeled with the stereo name, or it may say something like "CAR_MEDIA."

steps.title: Enter the Bluetooth passcode on your iPhone if prompted.
steps.content: Enter the Bluetooth passcode on your iPhone if prompted. If your stereo requires a passcode to connect, it will be shown on the stereo's display during the connection process, and you'll be prompted to enter it on your iPhone. Enter the passcode to connect.

steps.title: Play music or make calls.
steps.content: Play music or make calls. Open your iPhone’s music app to start playing your music on your car’s entertainment system. If you place or receive a call, your car speakers will act as your iPhone speaker and you will hear the voice of the person you’re talking to. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Check if your car stereo has an auxiliary port.
steps.content: Check if your car stereo has an auxiliary port. Look at the face of your car’s head unit and check if there’s a 3.5 mm audio port, similar to the headphone port your iPhone has. Car stereos have built-in auxiliary ports to support MP3 players, smartphones, and other music-playing devices. Check your car stereo’s manual if you can’t find or are unsure whether the head unit has an auxiliary port.

steps.title: Get an audio auxiliary cable.
steps.content: Get an audio auxiliary cable. An audio auxiliary cable is a type of cord connector that has an audio jack on each end that lets you connect any music-playing gadget to any electronic device that has an auxiliary port. If your iPhone doesn't have a headphone jack, you can purchase an adapter. There are adapters for iPhones with Lightning ports and USB-C ports . There are also AUX to Lightning cables and AUX to USB-C cables , if you don't want to fuss around with an adapter.

steps.title: Connect the cable to your iPhone's headphone jack and the auxiliary port on the stereo.
steps.content: Connect the cable to your iPhone's headphone jack and the auxiliary port on the stereo. Plug one end of the audio auxiliary cable into the headphone port of your iPhone. Take the other end of the cable and plug it into the auxiliary port on the car stereo.

steps.title: Set your car stereo to Auxiliary mode.
steps.content: Set your car stereo to Auxiliary mode. Press the menu button on your car stereo and set it to auxiliary (AUX) mode. This will allow your car stereo to receive any information coming from your iPhone. Check your car stereo’s manual if you do not know how to set your specific car stereo to auxiliary mode.

steps.title: Play music or make calls.
steps.content: Play music or make calls. Open your iPhone’s music app to start playing your music on your car’s entertainment system. If you place or receive a call, your car speakers will act as your iPhone speaker and you will hear the voice of the person you’re talking to.

steps.title: Check if your car stereo supports iPhone connectivity.
steps.content: Check if your car stereo supports iPhone connectivity. Look at the head unit (where your radio is) or inside the center console (between the driver's and passenger's seat) and check if there’s a USB port, similar to what you have on your computer. Some modern car stereos have built-in USB ports to allow playing music from flash drives. Check your car’s stereo manual and see if it supports iPhone connectivity. Not all car radios with USB ports support iPhone connectivity, so check your head unit’s manual first.

steps.title: Hook up your iPhone to your car stereo.
steps.content: Hook up your iPhone to your car stereo. Plug one end of your iPhone’s Lightning or USB-C cable into your phone. Take the other end of the cable and plug it into the USB port on the car stereo. Make sure you're using a data cable. The cable that came with your iPhone is a data cable, but you might need a different cable if your car only has a USB-A port (the wider USB).

steps.title: Set your car stereo to iPhone/USB mode.
steps.content: Set your car stereo to iPhone/USB mode. Press the menu button on your car stereo and set it to USB or iPhone mode. This will allow your car stereo to receive any information coming from your iPhone. Most car stereos will automatically change to iPhone or USB mode the moment you connect your iPhone to it. If your infotainment center supports CarPlay, tap or select the CarPlay option that appears on the menu after connecting your iPhone. Check your car stereo’s manual if you do not know how to set your specific car stereo to USB or iPhone mode.

steps.title: Play music or make calls.
steps.content: Play music or make calls. Open your iPhone’s music app to start playing your music on your car’s entertainment system. If you place or receive a call, your car speakers will act as your iPhone speaker, and you will hear the voice of the person you’re talking to. If you're using a CarPlay infotainment center, you can do a lot more than play music and make phone calls. See Use Apple CarPlay for more details. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Purchase an FM transmitter.
steps.content: Purchase an FM transmitter. FM transmitters are devices that allow you to play your phone through an unused FM radio frequency. They come with a device you can connect to using Bluetooth or a provided dongle.

steps.title: Turn your car on and find an FM station that isn't being used.
steps.content: Turn your car on and find an FM station that isn't being used. Most FM transmitters will allow you to use any frequency between 88.1 and 107.9 FM, but check your transmitter's manual to make sure. As you drive, you might need to change radio stations if your chosen frequency is used in a different area.

steps.title: Plug the FM transmitter into your car.
steps.content: Plug the FM transmitter into your car. Transmitters usually get plugged into the lighter port.

steps.title: Tune the FM transmitter to the same frequency that your car radio is on.
steps.content: Tune the FM transmitter to the same frequency that your car radio is on. Use the buttons or dials on the transmitter to adjust it to the correct frequency.

steps.title: Connect your phone to the transmitter.
steps.content: Connect your phone to the transmitter. Depending on the FM transmitter you've got, you can do this one of two ways: Plug the dongle into the headphone jack of your phone. If your phone doesn't have a headphone jack, you'll need to use an adapter. Use Bluetooth to connect your phone to the FM transmitter by going to Settings > Bluetooth and tapping on the transmitter.

steps.title: Start playing music or making calls.
steps.content: Start playing music or making calls. Depending on the transmitter you've purchased, it may have features that allow you to easily answer calls or change songs. Refer to your transmitter's manual for specific instructions, as each transmitter is different.

steps.title: Purchase a cassette tape adapter.
steps.content: Purchase a cassette tape adapter. If you have an older car, it might still have a cassette tape player. If so, you can use a cassette tape AUX adapter to play music in your car.

steps.title: Insert the cassette tape adapter into your cassette player.
steps.content: Insert the cassette tape adapter into your cassette player. Make sure you insert it with the cable coming out of the opening. The adapter will only fit into the cassette player one way.

steps.title: Plug the AUX cable into your phone.
steps.content: Plug the AUX cable into your phone. If you don't have a headphone jack on your phone, you'll need to get an adapter.

steps.title: Start playing music or making calls.
steps.content: Start playing music or making calls. The cassette tape adapter will play any audio on your phone over the car radio, but it won't come with any bells and whistles. You'll still have to manually change songs or place/accept phone calls. As such, make sure you only use this adapter if you have someone else in the car to help with your phone or don't touch your phone after you start driving, as distracted driving is dangerous and illegal in most states. Check the laws for the area you're in to be sure when you can use your cell phone in the car. For example, in the United States, Florida allows you to use your cell phone if your car is stationary [3] X Research source , and Montana has no restrictions on cell phone usage at all. [4] X Research source However, avoiding distracted driving is the safest option no matter what is legally allowed.
